content:
You should change rule 2 from 
"No spaces before punctuation marks except after a different punctuation mark"
to 
"No spaces before punctuation marks"
because none of your test cases or validators have different punctuation marks.
The problem is trivial to solve in Perl but as it does not have to be hard, I approved it.

I've edited the description of puzzle to reflect the code.

Perhaps add a test to show what it happens for strange input text :

"alpha,.beta;." becomes "Alpha, . Beta; ."

", ." as generated by your code show the contradiction of two of your rules :
* No spaces before punctuation marks
* One space after each punctuation mark

Your code also format  ",, ,," as ", ," : it can be see as a violation of the rule "Remove redundant punctuation marks"

OK, I admit that with the test and validator if someone respects the rules and even if he does a personnal treatment of the above cases, all the test passes. 

But perhaps you must say something about the constraints on the inputs.
Thank you for the comment. I will update the code to cope with multiple punctuation marks and spaces. I will also update the description accordingly.
I have updated the description, the sample code, and added another test case. I think I've addressed all your remarks.
